FuncDef:
The radius-server admin-user domain-exclude enable command enables a device to apply the undo radius-server user-name domain-included command configuration to the default management domain or the domain with the adminuser-priority level command configured.
The undo radius-server admin-user domain-exclude enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device does not apply the undo radius-server user-name domain-included command configuration to the default management domain or the domain with the adminuser-priority level command configured.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If some RADIUS servers do not support the user name format with a domain name and RADIUS authentication, authorization, and accounting need to be performed for administrators, you can enable the device to delete the domain name in a user name before sending it to the RADIUS server using the undo radius-server user-name domain-included command. Then, run the radius-server admin-user domain-exclude enable command to apply the undo radius-server user-name domain-included command configuration to the default management domain or the domain with the adminuser-priority command configured.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
